page.title: 10Home and Family
page.content: Most residents have come to this area in the last 20 years. All homes are supplied with electricity and main water and are heated with oil or solid fluel. All have septic tanks for sanitation. Families generally enjoy a comfortable, traditional family life. They have a telephone, washing machine, refrigerator etc. Most have a freezer and a car, which is necessary as the bus service is limited to twice a week and no shops exist in the area. There is a hospital car service run by local voluntary helpers. Most women like to sew or knit and some belong to the Womens Institute, while wine and beer making and gardening are popular sparetime activities. Everyone has a television which is the most favoured entertainment.
